intro: Macrocarpaea ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leaved macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are fibrous and have been used traditionally by Māori for their medicinal properties. Macrocarpaea ovalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
